reviews.text: This is a small and beautiful park near the Susquehanna and Chenango rivers. The place is good for a picnic and would be nice rest from walking.
Beautiful little park at the confluence of the Susquehanna and Chenango rivers. The river walk is one of my favorite places in the city.
Very nice well-kept good for picnic or public get together
Not very big. History explained on a plaque. Nice for a rest from walking.
Scenic local park at the confluence of the Susquehanna and Chenango Rivers.

A relaxing park to visit during the summer. It's free with lots of parking. Unless you go on Labor Day or Memorial Day weekend it never seems to be too busy. Great place to go swimming and get a suntan laying on the grass. That boat's the rent that you can take out on the reservoir and a nice loop trail that you can walk or ride your bike on. It's also got changing rooms, restrooms and a concession stand with ice cream and other treats that are really good.

Great for fishing, hiking,  camping,  and enjoying nature.  Boat rentals in the summer, as well as the camping.   Park is open all year.  Cross country skiing is great in the winter.   Groomed trails!
Very accessible because I love within walking distance
Great park for summer and winter activities! They have snowshoe and x-country ski rentals in the winter.
Went to go fishing but the lake was still frozen. Lol.

This is the biggest most beautiful park in Binghamton, New York. It features seasonal swimming, tennis courts, and a beautifully restored Carousel. There are walking pathways throughout. A wonderful woodsy area to hike around in, plus a well equipped playground for the children. There are two ample sized parking lots, also handicapped accessibility.
Great park for walking, jogging, or just a day with the kids. There's a pool, newly remodeled playground, and a swing that is handicap accessible.

Has improved since the 80's and 90's.
Carousel has been revamped and restored.
There is a new "Tree Fort" play ground.
Best priced pool in the area.
It is a shame they removed a statue that was put in place by Johnson since at or before the 1920's.
It stood there that long, until some snowflake made a big deal about nothing...
What a spectacular surprise this free merry go round was!  I loved riding it and being transported back to childhood.
Good place for playing tennis or soccer if not snowing:)

This is the biggest most beautiful park in Binghamton, New York. It features seasonal swimming, tennis courts, and a beautifully restored Carousel. There are walking pathways throughout. A wonderful woodsy area to hike around in, plus a well equipped playground for the children. There are two ample sized parking lots, also handicapped accessibility.
Great park for walking, jogging, or just a day with the kids. There's a pool, newly remodeled playground, and a swing that is handicap accessible.

Has improved since the 80's and 90's.
Carousel has been revamped and restored.
There is a new "Tree Fort" play ground.
Best priced pool in the area.
It is a shame they removed a statue that was put in place by Johnson since at or before the 1920's.
It stood there that long, until some snowflake made a big deal about nothing...
What a spectacular surprise this free merry go round was!  I loved riding it and being transported back to childhood.
Good place for playing tennis or soccer if not snowing:)

This is an awesome place to grab a beer or tea, some food, and relax. They have arcade games in the back and often have events planned. I had their pomegranate tea and it was very good! The staff is very helpful and accommodating of dietary needs. This would even be a great place to get a bite to eat and study.

A cool and laid back local eatery on a semi-busy street, with atmosphere of the old fashioned kind.  Good tasting, fresh, healthy food for vegetarians and meat lovers alike.  Not fancy, nor expensive.  Attracts  high school age and college students, as well as adults.  There is an upstairs for young group to gather.  The main floor is quiet and well lit.  A stage is available for bands and small productions.  Parking is sparse, so arrive early enough to secure a parking spot.

Great beer, food and people. Best spot in town is out back on the patio with a Mu Shu wrap (sprouts ftw), or Lil Lo's grilled cheese on a croissant w/ soup & homemade chips and salsa, add a stellar beer. I could go on... Did I mention they have Galaga?
Best vibes in binghamton. Good food great environment get your work done all in one place
Love the music and the food and the atmosphere.
Good homemade bagels, and Equal Exchange coffee.  Food and service was great.  Furniture could be a bit more comfortable for better coffee shop feel.

Awesome cafe. This is a great breakfast/lunch spot. There's plenty of seating area if you want to stay in, but you can also take your food to go. The sandwiches are very reasonably priced and theres plenty to choose from. The staff was very helpful in providing suggestions. They also have smoothies which are really good, I definitely recommend. Overall this place is really good and I would go back
Great spot, no complaints.  Breakfast is always satisfying and they have a variety of things to choose from.
Very nice sandwiches.  Quick service.

For Binghamton it's not a bad coffee / sandwich shop.  They really could use some lessons from CTB/Ithaca Coffee in Ithaca on their sandwiches.  Had the buffalo chicken and it was just a chicken breast, cheese and generic hot sauce - no extra flavor or seasonings in the hot sauce.  Could have been so much better if even blended with a soft blue cheese or even ranch.  Partner got a bar bq chicken special and the sauerkraut was overpowering and more plentiful than the chicken.  Also, two paninis, a soda and a tea was $30.  The panini bread was really nice though.  Some good ideas, but overall a fail.  Great location by the hospital will keep them in business though.  Decent coffee and nice bagels / breakfast (with egg/meat) bagels .
Nice atmosphere. Clean restaurant. We went for lunch during restaurant week to get the best deal. Food was good and nice sized portions. Waitress was also nice. I would go back again

Fun, funky ambiance, and great food.
High energy sit down restaurant, open floor plan gets loud. Great for weekday lunch menu, Full bar, items include penne all vodka, specialty burgers, sandwiches, specially meals, different sides, healthy & vegan menu. Entertainment on weekends. Diverse atmosphere.
Pricing roughly 16-$20per person with beverage cocktails $5-9 wine and beer
I like it

I love dining and socializing at Lost Dog. The staff is so friendly and helpful. The drinks are amazing. The entire menu is delicious. There are options to accommodate many different dietary needs. They will also make it your way if they are able. If you are in Binghatmon you need to go.

I love their trivia night and cocktails!! Wonderfully hidden little ninjas and such make it a jovial decor while remaining clean, sleek, and comfortable. I haven't had their food yet, but it always smells delicious!

The Lost Dog Cafe is a vibrant downtown eatery, popular with all ages. Their unique menu caters to vegans, vegetarians and carnivores alike offering dishes you won't find anywhere else. The food is fresh, the service is excellent and the vibe is wonderful.

I have been a long time patron of this store, and have told numerous people about it.  Beware of the parking lot just beyond the store.  There is a big "drop off" and it is not marked.  While attempting to patronize the store today my front right tire got stuck - as the drop off is not marked.  I was blessed to have a group of men from the surrounding businesses come to lift the front of my car off so I did not have to call a tow truck.  One of the men who was helping me told me it had happened to him before.  I contacted the owner Kathy Allen of Old Barn Hollow.  I was calling to make her aware of the dangerous condition, but she spent time wanting to give the number for the owner of the lot.  There is a sign for parking for Old Barn Hollow, so I felt it should be brought to her attention for her to pass on to the owner of the lot.  She indicated that there was a orange something showing that - but that was on the ground and not visible.  She showed no compassion for the trouble I had just gone through and ended the call by "laughing".  I am completely disappointed and will not patronize a store that treats customers like I was treated. * Update:  I just spoke with the owner of the lot.  Very kind and understanding and he will take care of the issue and make sure it is marked.  He acknowledged that there were markers but they had been knocked down.  I just do not want anyone else to have to deal with what I just went through.  If only the owner of Old Barn Hollow would have had the same level of compassion it would have made this much easier.  Customers are the heart of local businesses.

I was buying cupcakes for my Granddaughters' class for her birthday. Two of her classmates require gluten free food. No one except Old Barn Market had them. The selection was extensive. Thank you Old Barn.

I could spend ALL my money HERE, but I never remember to go. :( Thanks to an Instagram post, I made it in today to get a GF donut. So many fantastic, local products. I don't know the girl's name who was working, but she is very sweet. I love that they have a parking lot and I need to remember to go back.
Best Selection Gluten Free! Delicious Baked Goods! Ask for Leah...she's the Best!

Great selection from local farms and sources.  Great meat selections.  Local eggs, maple syrup and honey.  Very friendly staff.  Homemade bakery items.  Gluten free and vegetarian options.  Always need to stop when I end up in Binghamton.

First time there and the service was great.  The waitress was new but, I believe the owner, came out and made sure that everything was going smoothly and she knew what she was doing.  The basil seed drinks were a great find.   The food was also full of flavor and exactly what we wanted.  Very good!! We will definitely return!

This is some of the best cuisine I've had. I came here on a recommendation by family. The food was hot and tasted absolutely wonderful. The service was exceptional and had a very peaceful ambience. The owner consistently came and checked on my family and I. I definitely hope to come back, I left that night very full and content.
Very nice owner! The waiter was very understanding. We only had an hour before our bus departure and he made the whole dining super smooth and quick
Love this place. The lamb gyro is the absolute best I have had before. I have tried severest other dishes like the korma and have not been disappointed. The garlic nan bread is killer.
This was a bit out of the way as I was driving through the area, but I'm glad I stopped! We had great service, and large portions of delicious food. The restaurant was clean and well kept.
Excellent Hibachi dinner and sushi. Friendly, fast service. Reasonable prices and good portions.
The service was great we were welcomed and were seated immediately. The sushi was excellent. They were friendly and the experience was pleasurable.
Awesome food and service. The staff is friendly and helpful. When the mood for sushi or some miso soup occurs we know where to go.
We had a surprisingly good hibachi dinner.

We sat in a booth for quietness to able to have a more relaxed lunch. I've sat at the hibachi tables many times and the chefs put on a funny, family safe (unless your child is afraid of fire, then I'd advise sitting to watch the performance because **SPOILER ALERT** there are a few times that the chef intentional makes either the grill flare &/or makes a "volcano" (out of sliced onions) but that gets set on fire. **END OF SPOILER** But I really love having the exact same food served to me, without the wait, plus it being less noisy than the hibachi table is, which great fun for special occasions. And their prices are very reasonably. I was extremely surprised by how low the bill was. And the service, as always, is the best. I recommend this place to everyone.

I would guess it’s a “great or worst” experience here.
Since a month my husband has been bragging about how awesome the food in sake tumi is, so today we decided to visit the place. It was my first time but my husband has been here a couple of times he’d liked the pad Thai here. Today we ordered pad Thai & vegetable tempura. First disappointment was the tempura. There was more oil and less tempura!!
The next disappointment was the pad Thai itself, it was extremely sour, smelt real bad, veggies were bitter, tofu was over fried so it was hard. On the whole it was real bad. 
However the waitress was really sweet and agreed to take back the pad Thai and gave us veggie fried rice instead, fried rice I wouldn’t say was not great but was decent enough to eat! 
Also the menu said both the dishes contained egg, but neither of them came with egg!

Well I wouldn’t go back to sake tumi though!
They HAVE TO improve the food quality!

Definitely the best sushi I have had in the Binghamton area. I used to go every Tuesday and some Thursdays for dollar a piece sushi night. But lately I find myself coming in at lunch for their bento boxes. Only a few entrees fall short of the mark but by and large this is the place to go. The space is clean and really livens up when when they open the garage door at the front of the restaurant. Its worth checking out any night of the week.
The two chefs introduced themselves to me and everyone made sure I was taken care of. Super friendly and Monday is unlimited (select) sushi and nigiri for $20. I would highly recommend this place!

About what you would expect from Binghamton. Probably the best sushi in the area but definitely a far cry from literally any coastal city. Never get the ramen here. It is a literal 0/5. But this is a sushi place so I'm judging this place on the sushi.

Went here with a friend since we are both like sushi and you do get your moneys worth, especially on mondays when it's all you can eat for $20. Staff is friendly and food is great. Just be careful if you go to the all you can eat because you get charged for what you don't eat so don't be greedy.

I would guess it’s a “great or worst” experience here.
Since a month my husband has been bragging about how awesome the food in sake tumi is, so today we decided to visit the place. It was my first time but my husband has been here a couple of times he’d liked the pad Thai here. Today we ordered pad Thai & vegetable tempura. First disappointment was the tempura. There was more oil and less tempura!!
The next disappointment was the pad Thai itself, it was extremely sour, smelt real bad, veggies were bitter, tofu was over fried so it was hard. On the whole it was real bad. 
However the waitress was really sweet and agreed to take back the pad Thai and gave us veggie fried rice instead, fried rice I wouldn’t say was not great but was decent enough to eat! 
Also the menu said both the dishes contained egg, but neither of them came with egg!

Well I wouldn’t go back to sake tumi though!
They HAVE TO improve the food quality!

Definitely the best sushi I have had in the Binghamton area. I used to go every Tuesday and some Thursdays for dollar a piece sushi night. But lately I find myself coming in at lunch for their bento boxes. Only a few entrees fall short of the mark but by and large this is the place to go. The space is clean and really livens up when when they open the garage door at the front of the restaurant. Its worth checking out any night of the week.
The two chefs introduced themselves to me and everyone made sure I was taken care of. Super friendly and Monday is unlimited (select) sushi and nigiri for $20. I would highly recommend this place!

About what you would expect from Binghamton. Probably the best sushi in the area but definitely a far cry from literally any coastal city. Never get the ramen here. It is a literal 0/5. But this is a sushi place so I'm judging this place on the sushi.

Went here with a friend since we are both like sushi and you do get your moneys worth, especially on mondays when it's all you can eat for $20. Staff is friendly and food is great. Just be careful if you go to the all you can eat because you get charged for what you don't eat so don't be greedy.
Homemade pasta!!! Delicious! Very good Italian food. Great waitresses and waiters. They are very capable of serving large crowds,  a party of 18 is what we were. Cute gift shop inside the restaurant

I have been to The Little Venice years ago and it was barely so-so.... I went today for my wife's birthday (her choice) I was truly AMAZED at the difference. It is beautiful inside and the food was much better, everything is homemade secret recipes, and I couldn't be more happy about it. I will definitely be back again very soon.....

Atmosphere was terrific and service good but food was brutal. Who runs out of pizza dough at 6 pm on a Friday. Homemade pasta was extremely pasty. 1/2 soda products not available. Oh and gelato is not supposed to be runny. I eat out often and all over New York State and I have never been so dissatisfied that I felt I needed to write a review.

Nice atmosphere and delicious food! Everyone is super friendly! Was in town on business and unsure where to go, so glad we chose Little Venice! If business brings me nearby again I'll definitely come here to eat again :)

Lovely Italian food in Binghamton. Wednesday is half price carafes of wine. Always a good thing! I love getting the sampler with chicken cutlet, meat logs and sausage. It's a lot of food and you leave with leftovers that are easily another whole meal.

I grew up on Nirchi's and it will always be my favorite! However, I suspect even if I had not grown up on it, it would still be my favorite. I've lived in other counties whose residents have heard of Nirchi's and asked me to bring some back after visiting locally. They've never been disappointed.

Nirchi's is the bomb, it's a decent place to get a good meal for cheap if you just want a few slices, and their pizza is very consistently good. Their Chicken Bacon Ranch pizza is stellar, I highly recommend it.
Good local pizza. Tasty and made fresh right then and there. A local Binghamton staple. Don't miss going and tasting it.
Oh dear, not great quality and are you kidding me about the prices. I used to love it, not so much now,  disappointed.

This nirchis location is the best in the area depending on where you are. The are many locations which seem to have there own take on the same pizza. The pizza i get from this locaton is always consistent and fresh. I have never had anything else (wings, garlic knots ect). This location is super modern and nice inside. Alot of bench seating if you are wanting to sit inside with friends. 

The only downside to this location is very limited parking. All street parking which is usually full and can make it difficult for pickup.

One of the best views I have ever experienced in a diner, this was a huge positive for the experience. It overlooks a large river, with an expansive view of the area. The food was also extremely good, although I felt like the selection was slightly limited. Definitely plenty to choose from overall though. There is also mold in the vents from what I can see, which definitely looks unpleasant. Besides that, this place is extremely good.

Good food. Love the view. In all three times I've been there, I don't think I've had any less than an awesome waitress. The seating is comfortable, I have nothing bad to say about this place (...maybe just the parking)

Wife's club sandwich was excellent. I had the roast pork dinner. Soup was very good. The gravy on the meat and mashed potatoes was extremely salty, and I like salt. The side of broccoli was overcooked to mush and all the flavor was cooked out. Our waitress was excellent and took care of us very well.
I ordered the home recipe chicken sandwich. My friend ordered the eggplant parmesan. Seems like no time at all and we had both our meals. Very good cooks. Wheelchair accessible. Nice staff.
Very nice Diner.  Had a cup of soup and grilled cheese & bacon and of course coconut cake.  All was good.  Service was good.
Best bartenders in Binghamton.. good food.. nice crowd
Great service and great  people feels like home
Good food and service, enjoyable.
Love it here.  Wings could be better. But drink prices and bartenders are amazing.
Good burgers and bar food - hood neighborhood bar.

Dinner was blah and bland. Overpriced. Waiter was awesome. Dessert was superb - lemon blueberry cake!  Previous visit for lunch was yummy and great value for the food.  Great lunch spot.  Spouse prefers the bar menu.

Can't beat half priced wine bottles on a Friday night. They had a live band as well, which was fun. Server was very friendly. I ordered the fish sandwich for my meal and it was quite good. My parents enjoyed their prime rib sandwich and french onion soup as well.

I’ll preface this by saying that this is one of the nicest restaurants in Binghamton. 

With that said, I think it’s a bit overrated and grossly overpriced. The prices are similar to those you’d find in a Manhattan steakhouse which is a bit ridiculous, as the quality is nowhere near the same. It’s a bit odd that it’s sort of a combination of a sports bar and a high class restaurant. My steak was over cooked and tough, and the entrees were mediocre at best and certainly not worth the price. It’s a good place for one night out but not much more.

Food is wildly overpriced and overrated; their reputation for excellence is exaggerated by sentimental locals. That being said, it is decent for Binghamton, but still overpriced. Good service also extends only to locals/regulars, so if you're from out of town I'd suggest going elsewhere.
One of the best restaurants in Binghamton. Sit upstairs if you prefer a quieter atmosphere... Downstairs was quite loud.

While passing through Went here specifically for the Spiedies on a recommendation. The chicken was over cooked and very dry. The roll was dry too. Melted cheese wasn’t offered so I assumed it came with it. It didn’t.  The whole sandwich was flavorless. Fries were okay. Service was fine. The place was pretty empty at lunchtime. I liked the old time feel of the restaurant and it seemed clean.
Great food & lots to choose from! I can't wait to go back & try some more items.

My husband and I were in the area getting some work done on his truck and we were referred to Sharkey's for some food. WOW! The food was amazing!! I had the prime rib au jus and french fries and he had the pork speidies. Absolutely delicious!!! The atmosphere was so comforting and relaxing. Service was amazing! We live about an hour away and both agreed that we will be going back often.
Good food. Definitely recommend some of the don't aways have it specials. My server was right on the ball. Prices were average for the portion.
Family owned and Family Friendly!!  Great food, great people, always delicious!!! If you are in Binghamton,  Sharkey's is a must go!

I normally order one thing but i was getting something for my 13 year old twins. So I ordered a foot long Greek and chicken nuggets for them and some onion rings. First off i was Impressed with the size and quantity of it all. The best part was my son who is so picky ate the nuggets
Great food. Great prices. The restaurant is kind of shabby, but the food makes up for it. And the people who work there are very nice. Longest I've ever waited was 10 mi. for my food.
The Best! If you're driving through and have never had a speedie before, you must stop in and give one a try. You won't regret it. Every trip to Binghamton requires a stop in to satisfy my craving.
The best spiedies in this area. Staff is super friendly and service is fast.  My favorite place to get lunch.

Take out only! The spiedie salad was delicious, but come on guys, clean up the place! At dinnertime, the trash was overflowing, and the tables and floors were a mess. Also, the sun glared through the front windows. There were shades but they were difficult to reach. Space was small and cramped. Many patrons went for take-out, and that's what I suggest.
